        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative and transdisciplinary postgraduate programme that was put together by the University Lusófona, the University of Barcelona and the
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          , to train candidates with Human Behaviour Background (HBB), and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB) to intervene in human behaviour by means of digital processes, products, and systems (PPS).
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 1px; top: 62px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         CYBER is a two-year programme supported by Erasmus+. CYBER classes will take place in Lisbon, Barcelona and Paris, and internships across the globe with 35 associated partners. At the beginning of the master, CYBER teams (CYBER-T) will come together, pairing one HBB student with one EEB student. CYBER-T will work throughout the programme in assignments, projects, internships and final project and dissertation.

    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section uk-section-large" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">

       <div class="uk-width-1-3@m">
        <h2 class="uk-h1" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         About
        </h2>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-2-3@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative and transdisciplinary postgraduate programme that was put together by the University Lusófona, the University of Barcelona and the
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          , to train candidates with Human Behaviour Background (HBB), and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB) to intervene in human behaviour by means of digital processes, products, and systems (PPS).
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 1px; top: 62px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         CYBER is a two-year programme supported by Erasmus+. CYBER classes will take place in Lisbon, Barcelona and Paris, and internships across the globe with 35 associated partners. At the beginning of the master, CYBER teams (CYBER-T) will come together, pairing one HBB student with one EEB student. CYBER-T will work throughout the programme in assignments, projects, internships and final project and dissertation.
        </div>
        <ul class="uk-list uk-list-divider uk-list-large uk-margin-medium" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">

          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">

          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 2
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           <p>
            HBB students at University of Barcelona. EEB students at
            <span>
             Université Paris Cité
            </span>
            . CYBER-T a 2-month internship.
           </p>
          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 3
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">

            <span>
             Université Paris Cité
            </span>
            . EEB students at University of Barcelona.
           </p>
           <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 117px; top: -10px;">

            </div>

          </h1>

     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-grid-margin" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-width-1-3@m">
        <h2 class="uk-h1" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         About
        </h2>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-2-3@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative and transdisciplinary postgraduate programme that was put together by the University Lusófona, the University of Barcelona and the
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          , to train candidates with Human Behaviour Background (HBB), and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB) to intervene in human behaviour by means of digital processes, products, and systems (PPS).
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 1px; top: 62px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         CYBER is a two-year programme supported by Erasmus+. CYBER classes will take place in Lisbon, Barcelona and Paris, and internships across the globe with 35 associated partners. At the beginning of the master, CYBER teams (CYBER-T) will come together, pairing one HBB student with one EEB student. CYBER-T will work throughout the programme in assignments, projects, internships and final project and dissertation.
        </div>
        <ul class="uk-list uk-list-divider uk-list-large uk-margin-medium" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 1
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           All students at University Lusófona.
          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 2
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           <p>
            HBB students at University of Barcelona. EEB students at
            <span>
             Université Paris Cité
            </span>
            . CYBER-T a 2-month internship.
           </p>
          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 3
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           <p>
            HBB students at
            <span>
             Université Paris Cité
            </span>
            . EEB students at University of Barcelona.
           </p>
           <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 117px; top: -10px;">
            <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 4
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           CYBER-T internships across the globe, at CYBER associate partners’ institutions.
          </div>
         </li>
        </ul>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         The Master
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: false;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative programme that looks into behavioural and computer sciences to offer a transdisciplinary approach to study and intervene on human behaviour by means of digital processes, products and services (PPS). CYBER is a two years EMJM programme that joins students with two different backgrounds: Human Behaviour Background (HBB) and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB), and three universities: University Lusófona (Lisbon, Portugal), University of Barcelona (Spain) and
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          (France). HBB and EEB students will be paired into teams of two: the “CYBER Teams” (CYBER-T), working jointly throughout the programme. Two periods of internship will take place around the world in CYBER partners’ universities, research labs, hospitals, and companies.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          This course will accept candidates from areas related mental health and human health behaviour and IT, including Psychology, Medicine and Health, Computer Science, and Engineering and Technology. This joint master has two tracks:
          <strong>
           Cyberspace
          </strong>
          , more directed towards EEB students, and
          <strong>
           Behaviour and e-Therapy
          </strong>
          , aimed at HBB students.
          <span>
           The access to the professional associations is dependent on the undergrad degree.
          </span>
         </p>
         <p>
          A
          <strong>
           common formation
          </strong>
          is offered in the first semester at UL. In this semester, a team of two students (one form each scientific area: HBB and EEB) will be put together. The
          <strong>
           CYBER Teams
          </strong>
          (CYBER-T) will travel through the 2 years working together towards
          <strong>
           the goal of developing and submitting a dissertation
          </strong>
          (HBB) or
          <strong>
           project
          </strong>
          (EBB),
          <span>
           under the supervision of tutors specialized in the area of the student’s background.
          </span>
          In the second year, all students will take internships in
          <span>
           CYBER’s associated institutions (hospitals, research labs, companies, etc.), and classes that will support the dissertation/project’s development.
          </span>
          Dissertation/projects will fall within the scope of the student’s background.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

      <div class="uk-container">
       <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-grid-margin" uk-grid="">
        <div class="uk-width-2-3@m">
         <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          COMPETENCES
         </h1>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           CYBER educational model
           <strong>
            aims
           </strong>
           at:
          </p>
         </div>
         <ul class="uk-list uk-list-decimal uk-column-1-2@m uk-margin-remove-top" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <li class="el-item">
           <div class="el-content uk-panel">
            <p>
             Encourage networking (globalization), enhancing communication literacy;
            </p>
           </div>
          </li>
          <li class="el-item">
           <div class="el-content uk-panel">

environment;
           </div>

          <li class="el-item">
           <div class="el-content uk-panel">
            Consolidate strategic partnerships in support of research;
           </div>
          </li>
          <li class="el-item">
           <div class="el-content uk-panel">
            Work in tutorial system with supervised work with professionals or researchers;
           </div>
          </li>
          <li class="el-item">

comprehensive internships (globalization).

          </li>

        </div>
        <div class="uk-width-1-3@m">

       <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-margin-medium">
        <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-width-1-1">
         <div class="uk-flex">
          <div class="uk-background-norepeat uk-background-width-1-1 uk-background-center-center uk-tile uk-width-1-1 uk-flex uk-flex-middle" data-sources='[{"type":"image\/webp","srcset":"\/wp-content\/themes\/yootheme\/cache\/37\/setas-378f3295.webp 1600w","sizes":"(min-width: 1600px) 1600px"}]' data-src="/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/setas.png" uk-img="" uk-parallax="bgx: -540,0; easing: 1">
           <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
            <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
             <p>
              The CYBER educational model was established to allow CYBER students to develop the following
              <strong>
               competences
              </strong>
              :
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="uk-margin">
             <div class="uk-grid uk-child-width-1-1 uk-child-width-1-3@m uk-flex-center uk-flex-middle uk-grid-match" uk-grid="">

           </div>
          </div>

       </div>
       <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin uk-margin-remove-top">
        <div class="uk-width-1-1">
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           supported by specific
           <strong>
            strategies
           </strong>
           , namely:
          </p>
         </div>
         <ul class="uk-list uk-list-disc uk-column-1-2@m uk-margin-remove-top" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <li class="el-item">
           <div class="el-content uk-panel">

        </h1>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin">
         <p>
          CYBER EMJM will deliver
          <strong>
           transdisciplinary outcomes
          </strong>
          in the form of
          <strong>
           dissertations
          </strong>
          and
          <strong>
           digital applications
          </strong>
          (project) that will uncover the future of eHealth interventions.
         </p>
         <p>
          The dissertation/project, will take place in the 4 th semester, in the form of internships in CYBER’s associated institutions (hospitals, research labs, companies, etc.), while having classes that will support the dissertation/project’s development.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Master Dissertation/Project must be submitted in English.
         </p>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">

        </h1>

    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-grid-margin" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-flex-middle uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Laboratory of Experimental Psychology
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           The Laboratory of Experimental Psychology (LabPsiExp) is the place where experimental psychological studies are carried out. LabPsiExp consists of 4 sound-proofed rooms with light and temperature control, which meet the ideal conditions for psychological testing. This laboratory has psychophysiological and behavioral measures that allow a comprehensive evaluation of various psychological phenomena. Among these measures,
LabPsiExp holds two eye trackers, two EEG caps, three mobile electrophysiology sets (HR, ECG,
EMG and RR), and one emotion recognition system.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-margin uk-text-center" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <picture>
          <source sizes="(min-width: 474px) 474px" srcset="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/f4/person-pc-f464f8e6.webp 474w" type="image/webp"/>
          <img alt="" class="el-image uk-box-shadow-large" decoding="async" height="627" loading="lazy" src="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/a7/person-pc-a7e5e278.jpeg" width="474"/>
         </picture>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-margin-xlarge" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-margin uk-text-center" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <picture>
          <source sizes="(min-width: 474px) 474px" srcset="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/d5/cyberspace-d5839737.webp 474w" type="image/webp"/>
          <img alt="" class="el-image uk-box-shadow-large" decoding="async" height="627" loading="lazy" src="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/a1/cyberspace-a1dc5c28.jpeg" width="474"/>
         </picture>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-flex-middle uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Cyberpsychology Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           CyPsyLAB is integrated in the School of Psychology and Life Sciences from Lusófona University (EPCV-ULHT), being part of the school research unit, HEI-Lab. The lab supports the development of Products, Processes, and Systems (PPS) in the domain of psychological assessment and intervention. The interactive and immersive solutions developed in the CyPsyLAB have been used in multiple contexts, namely pedagogical, research, and psychological assessment and intervention, offering creative and innovative options to the traditional assessment/intervention approach.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-margin-large" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-flex-middle uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          MovLab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           With the mission to promote interdisciplinary knowledge,MovLab (Laboratory of Interfaces and Interactions) captures and digitize motions that are used in Life Sciences (human cinematic studies for biomechanics and health) and Entertainment (Animation, Film and Game Dev) areas.
          </p>
          <p>
           To collect cinematic data, MovLab has a Vicon Mocap System, AMTI Force Platform, RScan pressure plates, Biosignals devises and software as Vicon IQ, Blade, Nexus, Autodesk Motion Builder.
          </p>
          <p>
           To interact with the information collected, MovLab is equipped with VR Oculus Rift, Gear VR, Autodesk Maya, 3ds max, Adobe CS and Avid Media Composer.
          </p>
          <p>
           MovLab has strong experience in movement research for health and education, due to their expertise in cross areas of interests (Biomechanics, Physiotherapy, Sports, Programming, Data Bases, Animation, Film and Games) and to the practice expanded on several R&D project
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          VR-Psy Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          This laboratory is located in the Faculty of Psychology and is used by several groups at the center that carry out research on virtual reality applications for the evaluation and treatment of psychological disorders, as well as on perceptual processes. The lab has a long list of equipment, including various types of HMDs (Varjo, HTC Vive, HTC, Vive Pro, Oculus Rift, Oculus Rift S, Oculus Quest, Oculus Quest 2, Oculus Go); eye-tracking systems (Tobii, Eyelink, Fove VR, HTC Vive Pro Eye); motion capture and tracking systems (HTC trackers, motion capture suits); projection systems (hemispherical dome, Barco stereoscopic projectors), immersive sound systems (Genelec), etc.

         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          UB Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Event Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          he Event Lab is also located in the Faculty of Psychology. This laboratory is at the interface between computer science, psychology and neuroscience. They carry out technical research on virtual environments, with applications to research questions in cognitive neuroscience and psychology. Their special interest is the brain’s body representation and the consequences of body ownership. Some of the facilities available in this laboratory are a CAVE (virtual automatic cave environment) 3 × 3 meter room that offers a high resolution environment with stereoscopic vision of a computer created virtual world; Optitrack motion capture equipment with 12 infrared cameras; Intersense IS900 with 6 degrees of freedom; Optitrack facial expression capture equipment with 6 infrared cameras; equipment for measuring physiological signals Nexus4 (Mind Media), Mobilab + (Gtec), gUSBamp (Gtec), allowing to measure cardiac (ECG), cerebral (EEG), autonomic (skin conductance) and respiratory signals; several HMDs, etc.
         </div>

       <div class="uk-width-1-1@m">

          <li property="itemListElement" typeof="ListItem">
           <span aria-current="page" property="name">
            Selection process
           </span>
           <meta content="3" property="position"/>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </nav>
        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         Selection Process
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <div class="translate-tooltip-mtz green sm-root translate hidden_translate">
          <div class="trans_controls">
           <div class="trans_controls__control-wrapper selection">
            To be enrolled in CYBER EMJM applicants will go through a challenging selection process.
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <p>
          To guarantee a high-quality training, CYBER will only enrol a maximum of 12 students per academic scientific background- Human Behaviour Background (HBB) and Exact Sciences and Engineering background (EEB).
         </p>
         <div>
          Application process for scholarships for the CYBER 4th edition:
         </div>
         <div>
          <ul>
           <li>
            October 1st, 2024 until February 28th, 2025
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <p>
          <span>
          </span>
         </p>
        </div>
        <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-text-left" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         Application process
        </h2>
        <h4 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         1) Documents to submit online:
        </h4>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul>
          <li>
           Identification (Copy of passport/identification card)
           <sup>
            1
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Academic certificates
           <sup>
            2
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Curriculum Vitae
           <sup>
            3
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           2/3 letters of recommendation
           <sup>
            4
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Three texts explaining why you are applying to CYBER Master course; what are your expectations concerning the master, how do you see your future after master conclusion. These texts are to be inserted in the application portal
          </li>
          <li>
           Proof of proficiency in English language (IELTS 6.0; TOEFL, University certificate, etc).
          </li>
          <li>
           Recent head-shot photograph
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-meta uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul style="list-style-type: none;">
          <li>
           1)This document must be an official identification document including a photograph and personal data: first name, surname and date and place of birth. This data should be in English and it is recommended that the expiration date covers the duration of the entire master.
          </li>
          <li>
           2) Final university diploma from previous degree(s) and its transcripts of record – BA or Master with minimum National Framework Qualifications level 8 or European Qualifications Framework level 6. (If in other language than in English, additional officially certified translation into English is mandatory, and it should also include the University stamp).
          </li>
          <li>
           3) Must provide professional qualification(s), experience, places of work(s), job(s), task(s), professional skills
          </li>
          <li>
           4) It is required that the contact details of the person providing the reference must be clearly typed, with a business email address and a telephone number
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <h4 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         2) An individual interview for the top scorers.
        </h4>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         The individual interview will be conducted by the selection jury with two main objectives:
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul style="list-style-type: none;">
          <li>
           (1) to clarify the elements contained in the application;
          </li>
          <li>
           (2) to present and discuss aspects related to the organization of the CYBER EMJM.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-text-left" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         Selection criteria
        </h2>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The Academic Board will select students for the Master according to their academic excellence and motivation and taking into account the jointly agreed selection criteria that comply with the procedures and requirements in force in each of the consortium schools.
         </p>
         <p>
          In the selection process, the Academic Board will make all necessary arrangements to comply with non-discrimination objectives, by ensuring gender equality, integration of the disabled, enhancement of social and economic cohesion and the combat of xenophobia.
         </p>
         <p>
          An appeal procedure is in place and candidates can use it if they are under the requirements to issue one. Selection Board will be responsible for assessing those.
         </p>
         <p>
          The selection criteria are as follows:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The applicant’s academic quality, judged primarily from the results of prior university studies.
          </li>
          <li>
           The applicant’s motivation and justification of the application in relation to prior studies, work experience (if applicable) and future career plans towards the aims of CYBER, judged from the CV in combination with the letter of motivation.
          </li>
          <li>
           The applicant’s English language skills, judged from the certificate provided and from the interview.
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicants with the highest scores resulting from the application package will be called for a Zoom interview in a date to be settled by the selection committee.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to
          <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/ftp/privacy-statement-grants-and-prizes_layer2_en.pdf">
           this privacy statement
          </a>
          .
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </main>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">

    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          An appeal to the application process can only be put forward if a procedural error has been identified. In such case, an exposition should be sent to the following email:
          <a href="mailto:cyber-t@ulusofona.pt">
           cyber-t@ulusofona.pt
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          The appeal does not lead to an automatic revaluation. Please note that new information or clarifications that were not included in the selection and admission process will not be taken into consideration.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         Tuition Fees
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER EMJM will open 24 places, 12 for HBB students and 12 for EEB students, per intake.
         </p>
         <p>
          The tuition fee for 4 semesters is of 18 000€.
         </p>
         <p>
          The fee includes participation in all classes offered within CYBER’s curriculum; emergency and accident insurance according to the minimum requirements of the Erasmus+ Programme; support in administrative and organisational issues by the consortium partners; costs for enrolment at the consortium partner’s institutions; all examinations and the issue of the final diploma.
         </p>
         <p>
          For CYBER Erasmus+ scholarship holders all costs are covered by the scholarship. F
          <span>
           or self paid students, a cyberscholarship of 9000€ for tuition fees are available on a merit basis.
          </span>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <h3 class="uk-h3" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The tuition fee does not include:
         </p>
        </h3>
        <div class="uk-margin">
         <div class="uk-grid uk-child-width-1-1 uk-child-width-1-2@m uk-grid-column-medium uk-grid-row-small uk-grid-match" uk-grid="">
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               <p>
                travel costs between the country of origin and consortium countries, between consortium countries and associated partners countries (internships), and for attending CYBER summer schools, workshops, interim and final assessments;
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               accommodation and living costs in the consortium countries, associated partners countries and for attending CYBER summer schools, workshops, interim and final assessments;
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               travel documentation costs;
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               other costs, such as, study books, photocopies, etc.
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          To access Erasmus+ loan scheme, information can be found here:
          <br/>
          <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-master-degree-loans">
           https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-master-degree-loans
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          or here:
          <br/>
          <a href="http://www.studyinlisbon.pt/en/bolsas-de-estudo/">
           http://www.studyinlisbon.pt/en/bolsas-de-estudo/
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

    <div class="uk-section-primary uk-inverse-light uk-section">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1@m">
        <nav aria-label="Breadcrumb">
         <ul class="uk-breadcrumb uk-margin-remove-bottom" typeof="BreadcrumbList" vocab="https://schema.org/">
          <li property="itemListElement" typeof="ListItem">

            <span property="name">

            </span>
           </a>
           <meta content="2" property="position"/>
          </li>
          <li property="itemListElement" typeof="ListItem">
           <span aria-current="page" property="name">
            Scholarships
           </span>
           <meta content="3" property="position"/>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </nav>
        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         CYBER EMJM Scholarships
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-margin">
         <div class="uk-grid uk-child-width-1-1 uk-child-width-1-3@m uk-grid-match" uk-grid="">
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Candidates are eligible for an Erasmus Mundus scholarship (1400€/month + fee waiver), awarded on the basis of excellence.
            </h3>
            <div class="el-meta uk-text-meta uk-margin-top">
             Scholarship application is now open!
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Candidates eligible for scholarships are students who have obtained a primary higher-education degree or can demonstrate a recognised equivalent according to national legislation and practices of the degree awarding country.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students who have previously obtained an EMJM scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship under the EMJM.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Erasmus+ scholarship holders cannot benefit from another EU funded scholarship scheme to follow the same EMJM course. This holds for the entire period of the course.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students with a double nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify the nationality under which they submit their scholarship application.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             For self paid students, a cyberscholarship of 9000€ for tuition fees are available on a merit basis.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students with disabilities (e.g. long-term physical, mental, intellectual or sensory impairments) can apply for additional funding for as special needs provided by the Erasmus Mundus programme of the European Union.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-grid-margin" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-width-1-3@m">
        <h2 class="uk-h1" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         About
        </h2>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-2-3@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative and transdisciplinary postgraduate programme that was put together by the University Lusófona, the University of Barcelona and the
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          , to train candidates with Human Behaviour Background (HBB), and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB) to intervene in human behaviour by means of digital processes, products, and systems (PPS).
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 1px; top: 62px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         CYBER is a two-year programme supported by Erasmus+. CYBER classes will take place in Lisbon, Barcelona and Paris, and internships across the globe with 35 associated partners. At the beginning of the master, CYBER teams (CYBER-T) will come together, pairing one HBB student with one EEB student. CYBER-T will work throughout the programme in assignments, projects, internships and final project and dissertation.
        </div>
        <ul class="uk-list uk-list-divider uk-list-large uk-margin-medium" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">

          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           All students at University Lusófona.
          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">
           Semester 2
          </div>
          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">
           <p>
            HBB students at University of Barcelona. EEB students at
            <span>
             Université Paris Cité
            </span>
            . CYBER-T a 2-month internship.
           </p>
          </div>
         </li>
         <li class="el-item">
          <div class="el-title uk-margin-remove uk-h3">

          <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-h5 uk-margin-remove">

            </span>
            . EEB students at University of Barcelona.
           </p>

    <!-- Builder #page -->
    <div class="uk-section-primary uk-inverse-light uk-section">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1@m">
        <nav aria-label="Breadcrumb">

            </span>
           </a>
           <meta content="2" property="position"/>
          </li>
          <li property="itemListElement" typeof="ListItem">
           <span aria-current="page" property="name">
            Selection process
           </span>
           <meta content="3" property="position"/>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </nav>
        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         Selection Process
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <div class="translate-tooltip-mtz green sm-root translate hidden_translate">
          <div class="trans_controls">
           <div class="trans_controls__control-wrapper selection">
            To be enrolled in CYBER EMJM applicants will go through a challenging selection process.
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <p>
          To guarantee a high-quality training, CYBER will only enrol a maximum of 12 students per academic scientific background- Human Behaviour Background (HBB) and Exact Sciences and Engineering background (EEB).
         </p>
         <div>
          Application process for scholarships for the CYBER 4th edition:
         </div>
         <div>
          <ul>
           <li>
            October 1st, 2024 until February 28th, 2025
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <p>
          <span>
          </span>
         </p>
        </div>
        <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-text-left" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         Application process
        </h2>
        <h4 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         1) Documents to submit online:
        </h4>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul>
          <li>
           Identification (Copy of passport/identification card)
           <sup>
            1
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Academic certificates
           <sup>
            2
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Curriculum Vitae
           <sup>
            3
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           2/3 letters of recommendation
           <sup>
            4
           </sup>
          </li>
          <li>
           Three texts explaining why you are applying to CYBER Master course; what are your expectations concerning the master, how do you see your future after master conclusion. These texts are to be inserted in the application portal
          </li>
          <li>
           Proof of proficiency in English language (IELTS 6.0; TOEFL, University certificate, etc).
          </li>
          <li>
           Recent head-shot photograph
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-meta uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul style="list-style-type: none;">
          <li>
           1)This document must be an official identification document including a photograph and personal data: first name, surname and date and place of birth. This data should be in English and it is recommended that the expiration date covers the duration of the entire master.
          </li>
          <li>
           2) Final university diploma from previous degree(s) and its transcripts of record – BA or Master with minimum National Framework Qualifications level 8 or European Qualifications Framework level 6. (If in other language than in English, additional officially certified translation into English is mandatory, and it should also include the University stamp).
          </li>
          <li>
           3) Must provide professional qualification(s), experience, places of work(s), job(s), task(s), professional skills
          </li>
          <li>
           4) It is required that the contact details of the person providing the reference must be clearly typed, with a business email address and a telephone number
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <h4 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         2) An individual interview for the top scorers.
        </h4>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         The individual interview will be conducted by the selection jury with two main objectives:
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <ul style="list-style-type: none;">
          <li>
           (1) to clarify the elements contained in the application;
          </li>
          <li>
           (2) to present and discuss aspects related to the organization of the CYBER EMJM.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-text-left" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         Selection criteria
        </h2>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The Academic Board will select students for the Master according to their academic excellence and motivation and taking into account the jointly agreed selection criteria that comply with the procedures and requirements in force in each of the consortium schools.
         </p>
         <p>
          In the selection process, the Academic Board will make all necessary arrangements to comply with non-discrimination objectives, by ensuring gender equality, integration of the disabled, enhancement of social and economic cohesion and the combat of xenophobia.
         </p>
         <p>
          An appeal procedure is in place and candidates can use it if they are under the requirements to issue one. Selection Board will be responsible for assessing those.
         </p>
         <p>
          The selection criteria are as follows:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           The applicant’s academic quality, judged primarily from the results of prior university studies.
          </li>
          <li>
           The applicant’s motivation and justification of the application in relation to prior studies, work experience (if applicable) and future career plans towards the aims of CYBER, judged from the CV in combination with the letter of motivation.
          </li>
          <li>
           The applicant’s English language skills, judged from the certificate provided and from the interview.
          </li>
          <li>
           Applicants with the highest scores resulting from the application package will be called for a Zoom interview in a date to be settled by the selection committee.
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), in the context of managing the Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters, collects and processes the personal data of some of the candidates. In particular, certain data of the scholarship holders and non-scholarship holders is shared with the Agency and treated according to
          <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/ftp/privacy-statement-grants-and-prizes_layer2_en.pdf">
           this privacy statement
          </a>
          .
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">

        </h1>
       </div>

     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          An appeal to the application process can only be put forward if a procedural error has been identified. In such case, an exposition should be sent to the following email:
          <a href="mailto:cyber-t@ulusofona.pt">
           cyber-t@ulusofona.pt
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          The appeal does not lead to an automatic revaluation. Please note that new information or clarifications that were not included in the selection and admission process will not be taken into consideration.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         Tuition Fees
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER EMJM will open 24 places, 12 for HBB students and 12 for EEB students, per intake.
         </p>
         <p>
          The tuition fee for 4 semesters is of 18 000€.
         </p>
         <p>
          The fee includes participation in all classes offered within CYBER’s curriculum; emergency and accident insurance according to the minimum requirements of the Erasmus+ Programme; support in administrative and organisational issues by the consortium partners; costs for enrolment at the consortium partner’s institutions; all examinations and the issue of the final diploma.
         </p>
         <p>
          For CYBER Erasmus+ scholarship holders all costs are covered by the scholarship. F
          <span>
           or self paid students, a cyberscholarship of 9000€ for tuition fees are available on a merit basis.
          </span>
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <h3 class="uk-h3" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          The tuition fee does not include:
         </p>
        </h3>
        <div class="uk-margin">
         <div class="uk-grid uk-child-width-1-1 uk-child-width-1-2@m uk-grid-column-medium uk-grid-row-small uk-grid-match" uk-grid="">
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               <p>
                travel costs between the country of origin and consortium countries, between consortium countries and associated partners countries (internships), and for attending CYBER summer schools, workshops, interim and final assessments;
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               accommodation and living costs in the consortium countries, associated partners countries and for attending CYBER summer schools, workshops, interim and final assessments;
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               travel documentation costs;
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-panel" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <div class="uk-grid-column-small" uk-grid="">
             <div class="uk-width-auto@m">
              <span class="uk-text-danger el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="uk-width-expand uk-margin-remove-first-child">
              <div class="el-content uk-panel uk-margin-top">
               other costs, such as, study books, photocopies, etc.
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          To access Erasmus+ loan scheme, information can be found here:
          <br/>
          <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-master-degree-loans">
           https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-master-degree-loans
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          or here:
          <br/>
          <a href="http://www.studyinlisbon.pt/en/bolsas-de-estudo/">
           http://www.studyinlisbon.pt/en/bolsas-de-estudo/
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </main>

           </a>
           <meta content="2" property="position"/>
          </li>
          <li property="itemListElement" typeof="ListItem">
           <span aria-current="page" property="name">
            Scholarships
           </span>
           <meta content="3" property="position"/>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </nav>
        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         CYBER EMJM Scholarships
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: 50;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-margin">
         <div class="uk-grid uk-child-width-1-1 uk-child-width-1-3@m uk-grid-match" uk-grid="">
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Candidates are eligible for an Erasmus Mundus scholarship (1400€/month + fee waiver), awarded on the basis of excellence.
            </h3>
            <div class="el-meta uk-text-meta uk-margin-top">
             Scholarship application is now open!
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Candidates eligible for scholarships are students who have obtained a primary higher-education degree or can demonstrate a recognised equivalent according to national legislation and practices of the degree awarding country.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students who have previously obtained an EMJM scholarship are not eligible to apply for an additional scholarship under the EMJM.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: close; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Erasmus+ scholarship holders cannot benefit from another EU funded scholarship scheme to follow the same EMJM course. This holds for the entire period of the course.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students with a double nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify the nationality under which they submit their scholarship application.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             For self paid students, a cyberscholarship of 9000€ for tuition fees are available on a merit basis.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div>
           <div class="el-item uk-card uk-card-default uk-card-small uk-card-body uk-margin-remove-first-child" uk-scrollspy-class="">
            <span class="el-image" uk-icon="icon: user; width: 20; height: 20;">
            </span>
            <h3 class="el-title uk-text-lead uk-margin-top uk-margin-remove-bottom">
             Students with disabilities (e.g. long-term physical, mental, intellectual or sensory impairments) can apply for additional funding for as special needs provided by the Erasmus Mundus programme of the European Union.
            </h3>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </main>

        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         The Master
        </h1>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section" uk-scrollspy="target: [uk-scrollspy-class]; cls: uk-animation-slide-bottom-medium; delay: false;">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-lead uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative programme that looks into behavioural and computer sciences to offer a transdisciplinary approach to study and intervene on human behaviour by means of digital processes, products and services (PPS). CYBER is a two years EMJM programme that joins students with two different backgrounds: Human Behaviour Background (HBB) and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB), and three universities: University Lusófona (Lisbon, Portugal), University of Barcelona (Spain) and
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          (France). HBB and EEB students will be paired into teams of two: the “CYBER Teams” (CYBER-T), working jointly throughout the programme. Two periods of internship will take place around the world in CYBER partners’ universities, research labs, hospitals, and companies.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>

      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          This course will accept candidates from areas related mental health and human health behaviour and IT, including Psychology, Medicine and Health, Computer Science, and Engineering and Technology. This joint master has two tracks:
          <strong>
           Cyberspace
          </strong>
          , more directed towards EEB students, and
          <strong>
           Behaviour and e-Therapy
          </strong>
          , aimed at HBB students.
          <span>
           The access to the professional associations is dependent on the undergrad degree.
          </span>
         </p>
         <p>
          A
          <strong>
           common formation
          </strong>
          is offered in the first semester at UL. In this semester, a team of two students (one form each scientific area: HBB and EEB) will be put together. The
          <strong>
           CYBER Teams
          </strong>
          (CYBER-T) will travel through the 2 years working together towards
          <strong>
           the goal of developing and submitting a dissertation
          </strong>
          (HBB) or
          <strong>
           project
          </strong>
          (EBB),
          <span>
           under the supervision of tutors specialized in the area of the student’s background.
          </span>
          In the second year, all students will take internships in
          <span>
           CYBER’s associated institutions (hospitals, research labs, companies, etc.), and classes that will support the dissertation/project’s development.
          </span>
          Dissertation/projects will fall within the scope of the student’s background.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

           </strong>
           . Due to national legislation in the participating countries, a multiple diploma can also be awarded.
          </span>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
    <div class="uk-section-default uk-section">
     <div class="uk-container">
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-child-width-1-1 uk-grid-margin">
       <div class="uk-width-1-1">
        <h1 class="uk-h1 uk-text-left">
         DISSERTATION/PROJECT DEVELOPMENT
        </h1>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin">
         <p>
          CYBER EMJM will deliver
          <strong>
           transdisciplinary outcomes
          </strong>
          in the form of
          <strong>
           dissertations
          </strong>
          and
          <strong>
           digital applications
          </strong>
          (project) that will uncover the future of eHealth interventions.
         </p>
         <p>
          The dissertation/project, will take place in the 4 th semester, in the form of internships in CYBER’s associated institutions (hospitals, research labs, companies, etc.), while having classes that will support the dissertation/project’s development.
         </p>
         <p>
          The Master Dissertation/Project must be submitted in English.
         </p>
        </div>

        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Laboratory of Experimental Psychology
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           The Laboratory of Experimental Psychology (LabPsiExp) is the place where experimental psychological studies are carried out. LabPsiExp consists of 4 sound-proofed rooms with light and temperature control, which meet the ideal conditions for psychological testing. This laboratory has psychophysiological and behavioral measures that allow a comprehensive evaluation of various psychological phenomena. Among these measures,
LabPsiExp holds two eye trackers, two EEG caps, three mobile electrophysiology sets (HR, ECG,
EMG and RR), and one emotion recognition system.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-margin uk-text-center" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <picture>
          <source sizes="(min-width: 474px) 474px" srcset="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/f4/person-pc-f464f8e6.webp 474w" type="image/webp"/>

         </picture>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-margin-xlarge" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-margin uk-text-center" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <picture>
          <source sizes="(min-width: 474px) 474px" srcset="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/d5/cyberspace-d5839737.webp 474w" type="image/webp"/>
          <img alt="" class="el-image uk-box-shadow-large" decoding="async" height="627" loading="lazy" src="/wp-content/themes/yootheme/cache/a1/cyberspace-a1dc5c28.jpeg" width="474"/>
         </picture>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-flex-middle uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Cyberpsychology Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           CyPsyLAB is integrated in the School of Psychology and Life Sciences from Lusófona University (EPCV-ULHT), being part of the school research unit, HEI-Lab. The lab supports the development of Products, Processes, and Systems (PPS) in the domain of psychological assessment and intervention. The interactive and immersive solutions developed in the CyPsyLAB have been used in multiple contexts, namely pedagogical, research, and psychological assessment and intervention, offering creative and innovative options to the traditional assessment/intervention approach.
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="uk-grid tm-grid-expand uk-margin-large" uk-grid="">
       <div class="uk-grid-item-match uk-flex-middle uk-width-1-2@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-width-1-1">
         <h2 class="uk-h4 uk-margin-remove-bottom" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          ULHT Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          MovLab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          <p>
           With the mission to promote interdisciplinary knowledge,MovLab (Laboratory of Interfaces and Interactions) captures and digitize motions that are used in Life Sciences (human cinematic studies for biomechanics and health) and Entertainment (Animation, Film and Game Dev) areas.
          </p>
          <p>
           To collect cinematic data, MovLab has a Vicon Mocap System, AMTI Force Platform, RScan pressure plates, Biosignals devises and software as Vicon IQ, Blade, Nexus, Autodesk Motion Builder.
          </p>
          <p>
           To interact with the information collected, MovLab is equipped with VR Oculus Rift, Gear VR, Autodesk Maya, 3ds max, Adobe CS and Avid Media Composer.
          </p>
          <p>
           MovLab has strong experience in movement research for health and education, due to their expertise in cross areas of interests (Biomechanics, Physiotherapy, Sports, Programming, Data Bases, Animation, Film and Games) and to the practice expanded on several R&D project
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          VR-Psy Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          This laboratory is located in the Faculty of Psychology and is used by several groups at the center that carry out research on virtual reality applications for the evaluation and treatment of psychological disorders, as well as on perceptual processes. The lab has a long list of equipment, including various types of HMDs (Varjo, HTC Vive, HTC, Vive Pro, Oculus Rift, Oculus Rift S, Oculus Quest, Oculus Quest 2, Oculus Go); eye-tracking systems (Tobii, Eyelink, Fove VR, HTC Vive Pro Eye); motion capture and tracking systems (HTC trackers, motion capture suits); projection systems (hemispherical dome, Barco stereoscopic projectors), immersive sound systems (Genelec), etc.
         </div>

          UB Facilities
         </h2>
         <h2 class="uk-h2 uk-margin-small" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          Event Lab
         </h2>
         <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
          he Event Lab is also located in the Faculty of Psychology. This laboratory is at the interface between computer science, psychology and neuroscience. They carry out technical research on virtual environments, with applications to research questions in cognitive neuroscience and psychology. Their special interest is the brain’s body representation and the consequences of body ownership. Some of the facilities available in this laboratory are a CAVE (virtual automatic cave environment) 3 × 3 meter room that offers a high resolution environment with stereoscopic vision of a computer created virtual world; Optitrack motion capture equipment with 12 infrared cameras; Intersense IS900 with 6 degrees of freedom; Optitrack facial expression capture equipment with 6 infrared cameras; equipment for measuring physiological signals Nexus4 (Mind Media), Mobilab + (Gtec), gUSBamp (Gtec), allowing to measure cardiac (ECG), cerebral (EEG), autonomic (skin conductance) and respiratory signals; several HMDs, etc.
         </div>

       </div>
       <div class="uk-width-2-3@m">
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         <p>
          CYBER is an innovative and transdisciplinary postgraduate programme that was put together by the University Lusófona, the University of Barcelona and the
          <span>
           Université Paris Cité
          </span>
          , to train candidates with Human Behaviour Background (HBB), and Exact Sciences and Engineering Background (EEB) to intervene in human behaviour by means of digital processes, products, and systems (PPS).
         </p>
         <div id="gtx-trans" style="position: absolute; left: 1px; top: 62px;">
          <div class="gtx-trans-icon">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="uk-panel uk-text-large uk-text-emphasis uk-margin" uk-scrollspy-class="">
         CYBER is a two-year programme supported by Erasmus+. CYBER classes will take place in Lisbon, Barcelona and Paris, and internships across the globe with 35 associated partners. At the beginning of the master, CYBER teams (CYBER-T) will come together, pairing one HBB student with one EEB student. CYBER-T will work throughout the programme in assignments, projects, internships and final project and dissertation.
        </div>
